text:
Hi

I rasterize

 http://www.pinkjuice.com/howto/vimxml/pics/cos_pattern.svg

to

 http://www.pinkjuice.com/howto/vimxml/pics/cos_pattern.png

via

java -Xms64m -jar /path/to/batik/1_5/batik-rasterizer.jar
../pics/cos_pattern.svg -d ../pics/cos_pattern.png -m image/png -w 495 -h 113
-dpi 300

When I print the PNG in Mozilla (1.4.1) I get a black rect the size of the pic.
IIRC I also got nothing but a black rect when I inserted the PNG in a PDF via
XSLFO and FOP (that was just a test, I use the SVG anyways).

Tobi
creator: tobiasreif@pinkjuice.com
tobiasreif@pinkjuice.com
text:
P.S.

The PNG is printed correctly by Opera.

This

 pngcheck cos_pattern.png
 OK: cos_pattern.png (495x113, 32-bit RGB+alpha, non-interlaced, 80.6%).

also indicates that there is no bug in Batik's rasterizer or PBG output filter.

Tobi
If there is no bug can this bug be closed?
creator: deweese@apache.org
